body_html:
@asimshankar @tatatodd Sorry for late response. Actually I couldn't test exactly the same benchmark as before because my batchnorm layers (which worked well with TF version 0.9.0) returned "Incompatible shapes" error with TF version 0.10.0, and I don't have enough time to work on this...

Thus my new benchmark removed batchnorm layers and also used newer TF/CUDA version (0.9.0 -> 0.10.0 / 7.5 -> 8.0) and GPU (GTX Titan X -> GTX 1080). With this setting, I can't see those problems I found before. Using SyncReplicasOptimizer doesn't affect the training throughput and the worker throughput (trained samples/sec) is very consistent now.

body:
@asimshankar @tatatodd  Sorry for late response. Actually I couldn't test exactly the same benchmark as before because my batchnorm layers (which worked well with TF version 0.9.0) returned "Incompatible shapes" error with TF version 0.10.0, and I don't have enough time to work on this...

Thus my new benchmark removed batchnorm layers and also used newer TF/CUDA version (0.9.0 -> 0.10.0 / 7.5 -> 8.0) and GPU (GTX Titan X -> GTX 1080). With this setting, I can't see those problems I found before. Using SyncReplicasOptimizer doesn't affect the training throughput and the worker throughput (trained samples/sec) is very consistent now.
